text: Leo Tateusz Sugar (April 6, 1929 â€“ September 2020) was an American professional football player. He was a defensive end in the National Football League (NFL) for the Chicago Cardinals/St. Louis Cardinals, Philadelphia Eagles, and the Detroit Lions. He went to two Pro Bowls during his nine-year career. Sugar played college football at Purdue University. He was born in Flint, Michigan. Sugar died in Fort Myers, Florida in September 2020 at the age of 91.Flint native Leo Sugar, a former Detroit Lion and college All- American, dies at age 91 MLive.com, September 26, 2020 ==References== Category:1929 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Detroit Lions players Category:Philadelphia Eagles players Category:St. Louis Cardinals players Category:Sportspeople from Flint, Michigan
title: Leo Sugar
